interestingFact: The world has 195 countries, of which 193 are United Nations member states and 2 are observer states.
India is famous for the Taj Mahal, a UNESCO World Heritage site and one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.
Egypt is home to the Pyramids of Giza, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World and a top attraction.
Australia hosts the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef system globally and a World Heritage site.
Brazil is known for the Amazon Rainforest, the largest tropical rainforest and vital ecological region on Earth.
France is known for the Eiffel Tower in Paris, once the tallest man-made structure and a cultural icon.
Russia is the world’s largest country by area, spanning more than 17 million square kilometers.
China’s Great Wall is an ancient fortification and one of the most recognizable landmarks worldwide.
